# Analysis of Trends,Genres and Popularity

![](summer-movies.jpg)

Summer-themed movies have always captured the magic of the season, whether through light-hearted comedies or dramatic tales of self-discovery. This blog post explores the trends in the production, genre distribution, and audience reception of summer-themed movies using IMDb data, aiming to understand how this niche has evolved over time.

## **Data Description**

1.  **Source of Data**: The data comes from IMDb, available via [@TidyTuesday](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2024/2024-07-30/readme.md) (dataset released on July 30, 2024).

2.  **Description of Variables in the Dataset**:

    **summer_movies.csv:**

    -   `tconst`: Unique identifier for each title (character)
    -   `title_type`: Format of the title (movie, video, or tvMovie) (character)
    -   `primary_title`: Popular title used for promotion (character)
    -   `original_title`: Original title in the original language (character)
    -   `year`: Release year (integer)
    -   `runtime_minutes`: Primary runtime in minutes (integer)
    -   `genres`: Up to three associated genres (character)
    -   `simple_title`: Lowercase title with punctuation removed (character)
    -   `average_rating`: Weighted average of user ratings on IMDb (double)
    -   `num_votes`: Number of votes received on IMDb (integer)

    **summer_movie_genres.csv:**

    -   `tconst`: Unique identifier for each title (character)
    -   `genres`: Individual genres associated with the title (character)
    -   The `summer_movie_genres` dataset contains individual genres associated with each movie.

3.  **Data Cleaning Steps**:

    -   **Handled Missing Values**: Identified and addressed missing data entries to ensure completeness and accuracy in the analysis.

    <!-- -->

    -   **Removed Duplicates**: Checked for and eliminated any duplicate records to avoid over-representation of movies in the dataset.

    -   **Standardized Genre Formats**: Cleaned and standardized genre entries to ensure consistency, allowing for accurate genre analysis and visualization.

    -   **Filtered Out Irrelevant Data**: Removed movies with less than 10 IMDb votes to focus on titles with sufficient audience engagement.

    -   **Converted Data Types**: Ensured all columns, such as `year` and `runtime_minutes`, were in the correct data format (integer or character) for proper analysis.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# snippet of the code which involves data cleaning
summer_movies <- summer_movies %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  distinct() %>%
  mutate(genres = str_to_lower(genres))
```
:::


The above code snippet demonstrates handling missing values by removing incomplete entries, eliminating duplicate records for accuracy, and standardizing genre formats by converting them to lowercase for consistency.
